problem.markdown: Quizzes Q1. The survey which are made to fix the property lines, the calculation of the land area or the transfer of land property from one owner to another is known as ( ) Cadestral survey ( ) Geodetic survey ( ) Municipality survey (x) Property survey Q2. A survey which consists of horizontal and vertical and vertical location of certain points by linear and angular measurements and is made to determine the natural features of a country, is known as ( ) Geodetic survey ( ) Cadestral survey ( ) City survey (x) Topographical survey ( ) Hydrographical survey Q3. The survey which are made to fix the property lines, the calculation of land area or the transfer of land property from one owner to another is known as (x) Cadestral Surveying ( ) Geodetic survey ( ) Municipality survey ( ) Urban survey Q4. The size of drawing board used in the Johnsons table is (x) 45 × 60 cm or 60 × 75 cm ( ) 75 × 100 cm or 80 × 100 cm ( ) 80 × 120 cm or 100 × 120 cm ( ) 120 cm 150 cm ( ) 125 cm 175 cm Q5. In plane table survey the method used for locating details is ( ) Traversing ( ) Resection ( ) Radiation ( ) Intersection (x) (A) or (B) above Q6. The instrument which is used in plane tabling for obtaining horizontal and vertical distances directly without resolving is known as ( ) Alidade ( ) Plane alidade (x) Telescope alidade ( ) Clinometer Q7. Which one of the following is known as instrumental error in plane table surveying? ( ) Non-horizontality of board ( ) Defective orientation ( ) Defective orientation ( ) Inaccurate centring (x) None of the above Q8. In plane table survey, which is the error due to manipulation and sighting ( ) Non-horizontally of broad ( ) Defective sighting ( ) Movement of board between sight ( ) Defective orientation (x) All of the above Q9. The advantage of plane table surveying is ( ) Useful in magnetic areas where compass may not be used ( ) Suitable for small scale maps particularly ( ) Not much of skill is required in the work ( ) Contour and irregular objects can be represented accurately (x) All of the above Q10. The disadvantage of plane table surveying is that ( ) It is not suitable for very accurate work ( ) It is essentially a tropical instrument ( ) It is most inconvenient in rainy season and in wet climate ( ) Due to heaviness, it is inconvenient to transport (x) All of the above Q11. The process of determining the position both in plan and elevation of the natural and artificial feature of a locality for the purpose of delineating them, is known as (x) Topographic survey ( ) Contour survey ( ) Plan elevation survey ( ) Isometric survey ( ) Astronomical survey Q12. The instrument most suitable for plane table surveying when contouring is to be done simultaneously, will be ( ) Abney's hand level ( ) Sextant ( ) Planimeter (x) Indian tangent clinometer ( ) Optical theodolite Q13. Which of the following survey is preferred to determine the natural feature such as valleys, river, lakes, etc. ( ) Location surveying (x) Topographical surveying ( ) Cadastral surveying ( ) Reconnaissance surveying Q14. Which of the following is the largest size of drawing sheet? ( ) A 1 ( ) A 2 (x) A 4 ( ) A 5

choicegroup.choice: Useful in magnetic areas where compass may not be used
Suitable for small scale maps particularly
Not much of skill is required in the work
Contour and irregular objects can be represented accurately

problem.p: Q10. The disadvantage of plane table surveying is that

choicegroup.choice: It is not suitable for very accurate work
It is essentially a tropical instrument
It is most inconvenient in rainy season and in wet climate
Due to heaviness, it is inconvenient to transport
